settings.title: High Blood Pressure Medication
settings.subtitle: High blood pressure is also known as hypertension and if untreated can cause serious health conditions. Find our range of hypertension medication below.

settings.title: What is high blood pressure?
settings.text: Your blood pressure is the measure of the force that your heart uses to pump blood around your body. When you have high blood pressure you usually read between 140/90mmHg. When your blood pressure is too high it can cause a strain on your blood vessels which can lead to serious and potentially life-threatening health conditions.

settings.title: How is high blood pressure treated?
settings.text: High blood pressure can be treated with a variety of medications. You and your doctor will assess which medications may be right for you. The medications used can include ACE inhibitors, Angiotensin-2 reception blockers, Calcium channel blockers, Diuretics and Beta blockers.

settings.title: of all GP appointments in England are due to high blood pressure
settings.text: According to Blood Pressure UK, high blood pressure accounts for 12% of all GP appointments in England.

settings.title: of men have high blood pressure in England
settings.text: According to High Blood Pressure UK, around one in three adults in the UK have high blood pressure. In England 31% of men and 26% of women have hypertension.

settings.title: Buy high blood pressure medication online
settings.text: “If you have high blood pressure, your doctor may prescribe medication to help lower your blood pressure. There are many different types of blood pressure medications, and each one works differently. If you are prescribed medication for high blood pressure, it is important to take it as directed and to make lifestyle changes, such as eating a healthy diet and exercising regularly, to help lower your blood pressure!”
settings.name: Dr Sameer Nakedar

settings.title: Complete A Quick Online Consultation Form
settings.text: Fill out a quick and simple online consultation form to find out what products you are eligible for.

settings.title: Checkout Securely
settings.text: Once you have completed your consultation and selected your treatment, you can securely checkout online.

settings.title: Express Delivery
settings.text: You will then receive your order the next working day using our express next-day courier service, dispensed from one of our verified GhPC partner pharmacies in the UK.

settings.title: What do you feel during high blood pressure?
settings.text:
Most of the time, high blood pressure does not have many noticeable symptoms. Some signs that may mean you have hypertension can include:

Moderate-severe headaches
Shortness of breath

Nosebleeds

Anxiety

Palpitations

Feelings of pulsations in the neck.

settings.title: How do you lower blood pressure?
settings.text:
Sometimes changing a lifestyle habit can reduce your blood pressure, however, there are also medications available. Some changes include:

Lowering your salt intake

Eating a well-balanced diet with fruit and vegetables

Exercising

Reducing alcohol and caffeine intake

Losing weight

Stop smoking

settings.title: What causes high blood pressure?
settings.text:
There are certain factors that could be contributing to your high blood pressure. These can include:

Being overweight

Eating too much salt

Not eating enough fruit and vegetables

Not doing enough exercise

Drinking too much alcohol and caffeine-based drinks

Smoking

Having low-quality sleep

Over the age of 65

Having a family history of hypertension

Are African or of black Caribbean descent

Live in a deprived area.

settings.title: When is blood pressure high enough to go to the hospital?
settings.text:
If your blood pressure reading is 190/120 or higher

and

You have any of these symptoms:

Chest pain

Shortness of breath

Numbness

Weakness

Change in vision

Difficulty speaking

Severe headache

Seek emergency care.

settings.title: How long does it take to receive my order?
settings.text: All orders placed before 14:00 from Monday to Friday will be dispatched that day. The orders are sent using 24 Hour Tracked delivery provided by Royal Mail. Items will usually arrive the very next day after the order has been placed. We also provide tracking for your orders to check the status and location of your parcel.

settings.title: What is an online consultation?
settings.text: An online consultation checks if you are eligible to purchase the product. Some products only require an online consultation which approximately takes 1 minute to complete, enabling you to buy the product. Other products will also require a prescription; in this case, you will need to complete the online consultation, and then one of our partner pharmacy prescribers or doctors will review the online consultation questions and approve the order for delivery if you are eligible to purchase the item.

settings.title: How is the medication packaged?
settings.text: All our medication is packaged in plain confidential padded white or brown envelopes. This ensures that your orders are discreet, and the content of the orders will be for your eyes only.

settings.title: When will my order be delivered?
settings.text: If you have placed an order before 14:00 Monday to Friday, you will receive the order the next day.

settings.title: Can I return my order?
settings.text: For non-medicinal products, you are eligible to return the product within 14 days of receipt in the same packaging you received. For medicinal products, you are eligible to cancel the order only until it has been dispatched. From that point forward, you are no longer eligible to return the order.

settings.title: Can I cancel my order?
settings.text: You have the right to cancel your order for medication up to the point when your medication is dispatched.

settings.title: Is this medication suitable for me?
settings.text: Please get in touch with a doctor if you are unsure what medication is suitable for you. You can also complete our online consultation form to check your eligibility for the product.

settings.title: Can I order this if I am under 18 years old?
settings.text: No, we do not accept orders from individuals under 18. All orders must be placed by adults only.
